column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Mike :
#Text=The proposal is basically that
#Text=Turner will give us a venue for the conference and bring in industry people to speak , in addition to more citizen-oriented speakers and our own from Wikinews .
#Text=I know personally I did n't believe such a media conglomerate would want to partner with free culture , so it was surprising to me .
#Text=Does it surprise you , or do you see a good working relationship between " free " and " for profit " journalism outlets ?

5-22	431-432

column1: #Text=SG :
#Text=It does n't surprise me at all that Turner would want to partner with us .
#Text=I have had useful conversations with all kinds of people ; the head of CNN.com , the head of the BBC online , a head of programming at PBS , etc.
#Text=And I know many of us are having similar conversations .
#Text=People want to partner with the Wikimedia Foundation because it is extraordinarily successful and the material it creates is phenomenally relevant and useful .
#Text=Brian : we had a reporter with the beeb for a week
#Text=Dodge : And the BBC used some of our content earlier

#Text=Matt : Do you think the fact that they can reuse what we make in partnership with them is one of the reasons for people wanting to partner with us , whereas a lot of traditional media want to retain copyright on work ?
#Text=SG :
#Text=This is great , and it 's my opinion that we should partner up with lots of organizations in lots of ways .
#Text=Probably we will find the most constructive partnerships with the public sector organizations ( as Brian and Thunderbird are saying , with the BBC ) .
#Text=No , I do n't think they understand the GFDL at all .
#Text=And copyright is a problem for traditional media ; it was my single biggest problem at the CBC , since it is so constraining and complex .

#Text=I think they are interested in us because a ) we are popular , and they strive for relevance/popularity all the time , and b ) because we have managed to persuade people to participate in our world and to help us and work with us .
#Text=Traditional media have been less successful than we have — than you have ! — in creating an environment which people enjoy participating in .
#Text=Brian :
#Text=If they do n't understand GFDL , is CC-BY ( per Wikinews ) better for their legal folks ?
#Text=SG :
#Text=I think traditional media see copyright as a problem , and they do not understand it very well .
#Text=Basically it just represents cost and complexity to them .
#Text=I had a meeting with PBS the other day in which we tried to explain the GFDL to them ; it makes them quite nervous .
#Text=Matt : Do you believe that ( at least for non-profit news sources ) , releasing material into the public domain makes it simpler for them to manage/handle ?
#Text=Brian : or do they not understand PD ?
